fields.description:
h4. *Summary*
When you search for add-ons directly in the instance, the filters are not working properly.

*Steps to reproduce*
1. Navigate to Find New Add-ons
2. Choose only free add-ons
3. When the search is started, the filter is not applied and it is not possible to change to "Free only"
Please see the attached video
 [^find new add-ons.mp4] 

*Expected Results*
Would return only free add-ons

*Actual Results*
Returns paid and free add-ons

*Workaround*
Search for the free add-ons in the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://jiracoreonly.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/search?q=email], choose and then install directly in the instance
fields.summary: Find New Add-ons filters not working

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Bulk editing the due date in using a different language than English will return an error. And the error message is empty:
 !image-2018-06-14-20-12-04-982.png|width=563,height=191!
h2. Steps to Replicate
 # Use another language than English (French or Spanish, for example)
 # Bulk edit *Due Date* to June 14th

h2. Expected Result

The Due date get edited to June 14th
h2. Current Result

JIRA returns empty error message as shown in the image above.
h2. Workaround

Use a different language or change the Date/Time format to display months in number. For example, 14th June 2018 is shown as 14/6/2018
 * 
{code:java}
Advanced Setting:
jira.date.picker.java.format: dd/MM/yy
jira.date.picker.javascript.format: %d/%m/%y
jira.date.time.picker.java.format: dd/MM/yy h:mm a
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format: %d/%m/%y %I:%M %p
{code}

 * 
{code:java}
Jira Look and Feel settings:
Time Format:  h:mm a
Day Format:  EEEE h:mm a
Complete Date/Time Format: dd/MM/yy h:mm a
Day/Month/Year Format: dd/MM/yy{code}
fields.summary: Can't bulk edit due date using different languages than English

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When we click on an issue in backlog page, if the issue contains a sub-task, following fields will be visible for each sub-task in the issue details view:
* Issue type
* Issue key
* Summary
* Status

Please see the screenshot below:
 !Backlog - Issue details view.png|thumbnail! 

Currently it's not possible to customize these fields and add more fields to be visible for sub-tasks.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the ability to add/remove fields to be visible for sub-tasks in issue details view.
fields.summary: Ability to customize fields visibility for sub-tasks in issue details view in backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you set visibility restrictions to a given link (Bitbucket for example) in Application Navigator page, the restrictions are not reflected to Home. In other words, although the link to Bitbucket is not visible in Jira, it will be visible in "Home" view.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On Jira system dashboard, click *Switch to... > Edit*
# Next to any link, select *Hide* or add groups under *Groups* option and click *Add*
# Click *Switch to... > Home*
# In *Home* view, click *Switch to...*

h3. Expected Results
The application link set as hidden on Application navigator should not be visible


h3. Actual Results
The application link set as hidden on Application navigator is visible

 !Screen Shot 2018-06-13 at 8.15.27 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-13 at 8.15.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes


h3.Workaround

Not for now
fields.summary: Application navigator visibility settings are not reflected to "Home"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user uploaded a video that was created through Bandicam (which is using mp4v (MPEG-4 Part 2) codec), Media Player in Jira is not able to stream the MP4/MPEG4 video attachment.

We tried testing with the standard H264 Codec (MPEG-4 Part 10), the video can be streamed with the build-in Media Player without any issue. 

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Record an MP4 with Bandicam
# Upload the video to Jira
# Try to open the attachment

h3. Expected Results
# The video can be streamed using the Media Player

h3. Actual Results
# The video can be streamed using the Media Player

h3.Workaround
* Download the video, and play it in the computer instead
fields.summary: Media Player in Jira is not able to stream MP4/MPEG4 video attachment created by Bandicam (using mp4v (MPEG-4 Part 2) codec)

fields.description:
h3. Description

It would be nice if agents could comment anonymously or by using the company name instead of their own profile. The customer has reported that if the portal customers know which agent is treating their tickets, they want to contact the users directly.
h3. Suggestion

Allow admins to set up an alias so users can reply generically instead of using their own profile.
fields.summary: Allow agents to comment Anonymously

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* This should apply only on the "Create" transition
* Post-functions are executed in the order that they appear
* Currently, the UI inserts post-functions to the top of the list, thereby setting the most recently added post-function to be the first post-function to be executed

h3. Suggested Solution
* Only allow post-functions to be appended on the "Create" transition - i.e. inserting new post-functions at the bottom of the list if a post-function is added on the "Create" transition
* There is a use case for keeping new post-functions at the top of the list(allowing new post-functions to run first) on transitions other than the "Create" transition

h3. Why this is important
* If there is a post-function that tries to run before the issue is created/exists, then that post-function won't work
* Users may not be able to create, import, clone issues, etc.
 
h3. Workaround 
* Manually move the post-functions up or down using the up/down arrows:
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-12 at 4.49.22 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Workflow UI should append new post-functions to the bottom of the list

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performing a bulk delete operation, if one of the issues included in the bulk *contains a sub-task that is not included in the bulk operation.* 

This behaviour can be actually expected as Jira is avoiding to delete an issue that is not in the operation scope (deleting a parent also deletes the sub-tasks). However, the way this errors out should be better handled.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a task (i.e: ABC-1)
# Create a sub-task (i.e: ABC-2) 
# Perform a search that *includes the task (ABC-1) and doesn't include the sub-task (ABC-2)*.
# Proceed with a *Bulk Delete* for the search created.

h3. Expected Results
Jira throws an error describing that the opeartion is not possible because of a sub-task that is not in the scope. 


h3. Actual Results
Jira throws a generic error. !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
Manually check all the parents and remove the ones with issues outside of the bulk scope. Or include all the sub-tasks in the bulk.
fields.summary: Bulk delete throws generic error and stops if one of the issue is parent from a sub-task outside the search scope
Ordering by entity property returns "Internal server error" via Search REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If Issues are imported via a CSV file and include sub-tasks, the Ranking order gets lost on the Business Board and the Issues get's reordered according to its creation date. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Order search by *Rank DESC* and export Issues including sub-tasks from *Project A* in the Issue navigator (Export CSV(all fields))
# Using the *External System Import*, import the Issues using the *CSV* option to *Project B* (Business Project)
# Map all the concerned fields including the *Rank field*
# Completed the import and acknowledge

h3. Expected Results
On your Business Board in *Project B*, the Issues should be ordered by Rank DESC

h3. Actual Results
The Issues are ordered by creation date, ignoring the *Rank field* value.
 
h3. Notes
When importing without sub-tasks, the Rank order is kept on the Board. Importing the sub-tasks and tasks separately does not work.

h3.Workaround
No workaround known
fields.summary: Issues imported with sub-tasks loses Ranking order

In Jira Cloud Mobile App (iOS), you can't transition issue for Core board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot comment on issues while transitioning through the boards.

h3. Environment
* Cloud:  New Jira issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the workflow, add a screen to one of the transition that has only the comment field. (The screen that has no fields)
 !Transition__In_Progress_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
 !Configure_Screen_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to check the transition in any one of the issues, where we've added the comment screen. 
 !In_Progress_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to check the same transition in one of the issues from the board (enable new jira issue view).  
 !In_Progress1_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The issue must be able to transition in both the cases after adding the comment

h3. Actual Results
While transitioning through an issue view, the comment field is editable and the transition could be made with the comment

But when transitioning the issue from the board, the comment field is greyed out and cannot add the comment.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the new UI users don't have the option to set Boards or personal Dashboard as their default homepage instead of the current dashboard.
h3. Suggested Solution

Users can choose to set Boards as their default homepage in JIRA so that they will go straight to JIRA Agile whenever they log into JIRA or click the JIRA logo at the top left of any page.
h3. Workaround

Add custom links in the application navigator [Creating links in the application navigator \- Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-945104646.html].
fields.summary: Ability to set a JIRA Agile board as home page in Jira new UI

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition

In the "Project List" screen (https://<example>.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa) it is possible to see the type of the Project (Business, Software, Service Desk), however, it is not possible to see the template that is being used in these projects 
e.g. Software project - would be nice to see if it is Scrum, Kanban or Agility in the Project list.
Please see the screenshot below.
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-11 at 11.17.32.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Suggested Solution

Add a column to see the templates that are being used, or have this informed next to the "Software", under the column "Project type". 
E.g. Software - Agility

h4. Why this is important

Enhance the user and admin experience, allowing them to have better control over their projects and also save their time, as they would need to open the projects to check the template that is being used.
fields.summary: Ability to see the project template from the "Project list"

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Currently, the Projects Browser shows the column "Owner" displaying the project lead's field value (The user), the names are different but should mean the same thing.

h4. Suggestion
On the Projects Browser, change the column "Owner" to "Project lead" to match the project details field so it's more consistent to understand.
fields.summary: On the Projects Browser, change the column "Owner" to "Project lead" to match the project details field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are unable to add an attachment to an issue when editing the issue from a filter results gadget on the dashboard. You receive the following error "An internal error has occurred. Please contact your administrator.".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a filter results gadget and display issues on the dashboard
 # Click the ellipses next to the issue > edit
 # Try to add an attachment either drag or browse
 # Attachment fails with the error "An internal error has occurred. Please contact your administrator."

h3. Expected Results

The attachment is added to the issue
h3. Actual Results
 * upload results in an error "An internal error has occurred. Please contact your administrator."

h3. Notes
 * Nothing is logged in Jira / Splunk
 * Adding attachments works when you're using the issue view
 * Viewing the network tab from the developer console shows the following, note the end of line token=undefined, potentially it doesn't know which form to use:
{noformat}
Request URL:https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/rest/internal/2/AttachTemporaryFile?filename=Cross-the-Line-500x381.jpg&size=34003&atl_token=3218a5f9-6352-46c1-85ef-3e183c94f56b%7C410abafe392b92958a50829081cb77f36796f5f1%7Clin&formToken=undefined
Request Method:POST
Status Code:400 
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Open issue directly from project or search and then add the attachment
fields.summary: Unable to add attachment when editing issue from filter results gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

 Not able to fill in screens that are triggered from a transition on board new issue view
h3. Environment 
 * Tested in Google Chrome, Google Chrome incognito mode, Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Transition screen to workflow transition
 # Go to Board on either JIRA Core or JIRA Software
 # Create a new issue in the board
 # Open the issue and transition to next status, once transition screen opens, try typing in the any text/comment box

h3. Expected Results
 * Transition ticket with comment/text entered

h3. Actual Results 
 * Transitions without any comment or text added to the issue

!Actual.gif|width=581,height=285!
h3. Notes 
 * Affects both JIRA Core and JIRA Software

h3. Workaround

 * Go to Issues and Filters and edit ticket
fields.summary: Not able to fill in screens that are triggered from a transition on boards in new issue view

fields.description:
Deleting a task with a considerable number of sub-tasks sometimes fails due to a timeout
{code}
	 stack:	 com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught PSQLException for delete from "public"."issuelink" "ISSUE_LINK"

where "ISSUE_LINK"."id" = ?
	at com.querydsl.sql.DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.java:50)
	at com.querydsl.sql.Configuration.translate(Configuration.java:508)
	at com.querydsl.sql.dml.AbstractSQLDeleteClause.execute(AbstractSQLDeleteClause.java:223)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.lambda$removeIssueLinkInternal$0(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:175)
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.DefaultQueryDslAccessor.lambda$executeQuery$0(DefaultQueryDslAccessor.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.DatabaseAccessorImpl.runInTransaction(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:82)

	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.removeIssueLinksInternal(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:263)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.removeIssueLinksNoChangeItems(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:243)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.removeIssueLinks(DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.java:211)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.deleteIssue(DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.java:156)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.deleteIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:888)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkDeleteOperation.perform(BulkDeleteOperation.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.BulkEditTaskRunnerImpl.runTask(BulkEditTaskRunnerImpl.java:114)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressAwareMessageRunner.processMessage(ProgressAwareMessageRunner.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.core.NestedMessageConsumer.consume(NestedMessageConsumer.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.sqs.SQSMessageConsumer.processReceiveMessageResult(SQSMessageConsumer.java:171)

Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: canceling statement due to statement timeout
  Where: while deleting tuple (45,98) in relation "issuelink"
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2477)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2190)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:300)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeInternal(PgStatement.java:428)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.execute(PgStatement.java:354)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeWithFlags(PgPreparedStatement.java:169)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PgPreparedStatement.java:136)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor390.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.AbstractInvocationHandler.targetInvoke(AbstractInvocationHandler.java:154)
	at org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.StatementInvocationHandler.doProcessExecute(StatementInvocationHandler.java:224)
	at org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.StatementInvocationHandler.on(StatementInvocationHandler.java:214)
	at com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.lambda$null$5(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:149)
	at org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.StatementInvocationHandler.processExecute(StatementInvocationHandler.java:149)

Even though it is not that common to have over 100 sub-tasks under a single task, this can easily occur. In those cases, every once in a while, the process hangs until a timeout is returned.

This timeout value could be increased a little bit in order to guarantee that, even though the process may take a while to be completed, it would not fail.

fields.description:
When entering the @ charachter Jira automatically starts to filter for other users which is a cool feature. The feature could be improved by ignoring those special characters when typing and filtering (as it is for example not so cool to type those on a english keyboard). For example:

We have a user with the name 'Fréderick'. When I do enter know 'Fre' Jira does not propose me 'Fréderick' as it appears that the characters must match exactly. It would be nice that Fréderick gets proposed even though I am just entering a normal e instead of the é.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the Quick Search box when entering keywords that are present only in comments no result is listed

h3. Environment
Jiar Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click in Quick Search box. 
# Type in a keyword or something that is in the comments section of an issue

h3. Expected Results
A list of issues containing the typed keyword on the comments should be displayed like it does when the keyword is in the summary:
 !finding.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
No ticket is listed
  !not-finding.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Notes
When clicking on View all matching issues 
Jira auto-generates the following query:
{code:SQL}
summary ~ "Keyword*" OR description ~ "Keyword*" ORDER BY lastViewed DESC
{code}

But the ideal query would be:
{code:SQL}
summary ~ "Keyword*" OR description ~ "Keyword*" OR comment ~ "Keyword*" ORDER BY lastViewed DESC
{code}

h3.Workaround
Use the advanced search for keywords in the comments section
fields.summary: Quick search is not bringing results from comments

fields.description:
Clients claim that, when using "not in", fields with empty values are ignored by the comparison. Example below:

fixVersion 1
fixVersion 2
fixVersion (empty)

if fixVersion not in (2) is searched, only fixVersion 1 will be retrieved. Empty should be retrieved as well.
fields.summary: Allow Jira to include empty values when comparing using "not in"

fields.description:

There is no button to click to confirm the creation of an issue from the backlog, as the screenshot below.

fields.description:
Currently, when you invite a new user to the instance and this user logs for the first time, it'll be presented options to create a sample project, create a new project or to import issues.

Those 3 are usually not relevant for some instances. So, I'd like to suggest to either add a button 'Skip and proceed to Dashboard' or make this optional per user.

What currently happens is that many new 'sample' projects are created, including all the new schemes which give admins a lot of things to clean up afterward, or the users get stuck because they try to create a project but they don't have permission and Jira send them back to the creation page.
fields.summary: Add option to 'Skip' and proceed to the Dashboard for new Jira users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, it is not possible to update the "Fix Version" with a post function. The "Copy value from other field" is currently not working for "Versions" type of field (refer to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21376).

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a post-function that updates the value of "Versions" type of field.

h3. Why this is important
Allow more flexible workflow design, reaching a broader range of businesses needs.

h3. Workaround 
Admins can use add-ons to achieve this goal. A few names are: *Jira Misc Workflow Extensions, Automation Lite for Jira and Automation for Jira*.

 !Automation rule 1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to update the "Fix Version" field with a post function

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there's no built-in feature to disable @mention notifications for a specific project.
h3. Suggested Solution

As an admin, I should be able to disable/enable the @mention email notifications for any project.
h3. Why this is important

This functionality could help to prevent sensitive information to be exposed when the @mention feature is being used.
h3. Workaround

There are two things that allow @mention to work.
 * The @mention uses the *Browse Users* global permission to determine whether they will be able to see the user list or not. So to prevent this you can remove all groups in the Browse Users global permission so your user would not be able to search for the user at all. The downside of doing this is you would not be able to search for the user even in any other field such as Assignee or Reporter. For more details please see [Managing global permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-global-permissions-776636359.html].

 * The comment field needs to be of *Wiki Style Renderer*. By default; fields like *Description* or *Comment* is set to Wiki Style Renderer. If you change it to Default Text Renderer in your Field Configuration; you will no longer be able to use @mention. However, you'd also not be able to styling your text in the Comment any more and you can't no longer use tags such as the code tag. For instructions please refer to [Specifying field behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/specifying-field-behavior-776636443.html].
fields.summary: Ability to disable the @mention notifications for a specific project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Ticking multiple Project Role when in the *People* menu is not working. Only the first role chosen will be applied.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a new user to a role.
# Choose more than 1 role to assign at once.

h3. Expected Results
All ticked roles are assigned to the user.

h3. Actual Results
Only the first role chosen is applied. If you try to edit the roles and tick more, only the original role will remain.
 
h3.Workaround
Use the *Add people* button to add more role to a single user.
You can remove roles by unticking though.
fields.summary: Ticking multiple project roles does not work

fields.description:
Currently, when a request for access to a dashboard is sent, there is no way to modify the recipient list. It's pre-filled and greyed out as *Administer Jira*.

 !Screen Shot 2018-06-05 at 2.50.40 PM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new issue view:
 * When the triggered screen for the transition between two statuses include fields of type "Text (multi-line)" the field appears non editable.
 * If this field is required, the user won't be able to to finish the transition.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to new issue view board
 # Ensure that transitioning is configured to trigger a screen.
 # Ensure that the screen include a Text Field (multi-line).
 # When changing the status the configured screen will get triggered.
 # You will notice that all the fields from type "Text (multi-line)" are non-editable.

h3. Expected Results
 * When a screen is triggered during a transition, the user is able to fill in the data in the different fields.

h3. Actual Results
 * As shown in this video [[[^Recording #170.mp4]]], the field is non editable.

h3. Notes
 * This same behavior is not experienced when transitioning the issue through a drag and drop.

h3. Workaround

Currently the workaround is to use the drag and drop option as shown in the video.
fields.summary: Cannot update Text Field (multi-line) when screen is triggered during transition in the New Jira Issue View

Logged work displays *1.7h*

 !time_tracking_17h.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the option *Dashboards* in the sidebar behaves differently if there is/isn't a favorite dashboard:
 * If you haven't set any dashboard as favorite, when you click on *Dashboards* (in sidebar), you'll be directed to 'System dashboard'. And an announcement appears indicating that you don't have any favorite dashboard, which includes a link to 'View all dashboards' page.
 * If you set a favorite dashboard, when you click on *Dashboard* option, you'll be able to see following options:
 ** System dashboard
 ** Your favorite dashboard(s)
 ** View all dashboards

h3. Suggested Solution

User should get same behaviour whether the user has/hasn't any favorite dashboard, and he/she should be able to access 'View all dashboards' page through sidebar navigation.
fields.summary: Ability to access 'View all dashboards' page through sidebar navigation when there's no favorite dashboard set

fields.description:
h3. Summary
We provide the options to set workflow condition using "Account" (Tempo Field) custom field in "Value Field" condition. However, it didn't work properly. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket in an instance that have Tempo add on and have Account custom field.
# Then , set the Account field . (In the ticket will display the Account Name , but in JIRA Database it stored the Account id). For example , now the Account id = 50
# Open the workflow , choose the transition and go to *Conditions*
# Click *Add Condition > Value Field*. Set as below :-
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-04 at 9.44.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then, view back the ticket. The transition button is dissapear. 
# Then, change the Account value. The button should appear because the value no longer 50.

h3. Expected Results
The button should appear because the value no longer 50.

h3. Actual Results
The button is not appear
 
h3. Notes
# In JIRA Database , the number stored is the Tempo Account id. 
# However, the Account custom field type is Account (Its not number or string).
# You can check the custom field value from {{select * from customfieldvalue}}
fields.summary: Unable to set workflow condition using "Account" custom field

fields.description:
*Summary*
When editing a filter, if a field has many values it's not possible to select a large number of them. 

*Environment*

*Steps to Reproduce*
# create a custom field with more than 1000 (a thousand) values and each value should have at least 15 (fifteen) characters
# create a filter using: one project, a couple of issue types, three or more statuses and the custom field with more than 100 (a hundred) values selected
# try to edit the filter, selecting more values for the custom field

*Expected Results*
The filter can accept the values.

*Actual Results*
At some point, the filter breaks.

*Workaround*
Create more than one filter in order to don't use so many values in one field.
fields.summary: When editing a filter, if a field has many values it's not possible to select a large number of them.

fields.description:
h3. _*Scenario A*_:
When a *Task*, *Story* or an *Epic* child issues such as sub-tasks, move from TO DO to {color:#0000ff}IN PROGRESS{color}, the parent issue should also move to that status. 

h3. _*Scenario B*_:
When all the child issues are on {color:#008000}DONE{color} status, the parent issue should be consider as {color:#008000}DONE{color} too. The same should happen when the parent is consider a completed issue (all its sub-tasks should move to *Done* status).
fields.summary: Parent status based on it's child issues and vice versa.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When pasting a line to comment with 2 backslash in Jira new issue view, only 1 backslash will appear. Sample of a line with 2 backslash:
{panel} 
Network:\\test\folder
{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Copy "Network:\\test\folder"

* 2 backslash that is copied to clipboard should appear as it is.

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Current JIRA does not handle non-ASCII characters (aka diacritic) well when they are in filenames. 

h3.Investigation Done

For example '‪Gebruiker‬ (‎‪1‬)‎‪.png' looks like a normal file name but in actuality it actually contains non ASCII characters.  When users attempt to link the image in the comment inline, it will not work.

!Gebruiker‬ (‎‪1‬)‎‪.png|thumbnail!

As seen as above, the macro to display image thumbnail fails due to the special characters hidden in the file name despite the correct file name referenced.

h3.Expected Behavior

When a file with special characters is uploaded, JIRA should be able to strip away any special characters from the file name or just replace the special characters with another ASCII character (like underscore for example). 

h3.Current Behavior

Currently, special characters in the file name are left as it is. When users attempt to mention the same file in comments, it will not work.

h3.Workaround

Rename the file by removing the file name entirely and typing in the name again manually.
fields.summary: JIRA does not handle formatting characters in filenames well

fields.description:
Currently, when a customer upgrades from Jira Core to Jira Software, global permissions are not updated. They keep settings for *Jira-core-users* group only. They need to be updated manually.

It would be a better user experience if they update automatically accordingly.
fields.summary: Upgrade from Jira Core to Jira Software does not update global permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the board view, when clicking upon a card(which is a parent), the sub-task time tracking original estimation is not summed up to its parent time tracking original estimation field within the New JIRA Issue View.

The same applies when we directly access the issue (card). 
However, when clicking on a card in the board (in old view), it opens a pop up box on the right which shows the time estimation for both parent and subtasks.

 
h4. New issue view

Board click on card : 

  !Board view cick on card.png|thumbnail! 

Parent issue view :

!Parent task.png|thumbnail!

Subtask:
 !Sub task.png|thumbnail!

However, in the old view, it does show the sum value of the original estimation in parents and in sub-tasks.
h4. Old issue view
Board click on card :
 !Board view click on card(Old view).png|thumbnail! 
Parent

!Parent task old view.png|thumbnail!

Subtasks:
 !Sub task old view.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to board settings > Estimations
 2. Set the estimation statistics to Original Time Estimate
 3. Under Time tracking, choose Jira's Remaining Estimate and Time Spent fields.
 4. Now create an issue and add the original time estimate
 5. Within the issue, create a subtask and add the original time estimate as well

*Example* :
 - When an issue has 100m set in time tracking.
 - For the subtask of that issue, it is also set for 100m.
 - When viewing the issue in backlog and active sprint boards.
 - The expected value for the time tracking should equal to 200m
 - However, it only shows the parent issue which is 100m

h3. Expected Result:

The parent task should have the sum of the Original Time Estimate of the current issue and the subtasks.
h3. Actual Result:

The parent task only shows its original time estimate and not including the sum of the subtasks.
h3. Workaround:

You can choose from either option:
 1. Turn off the New JIRA Issue View.
 2. View the time estimation from the board itself where it shows the time estimate in the cards
 !Card view .png|thumbnail! 
 3. Use filter navigator where you can add the column (Original time estimate) to view the total time estimation for the issue

!Filter navigator.png|thumbnail!

h3. Update as at 8th Jan 2020
This issue is related to the subtask JRACLOUD-70150 , you can use the workaround mentioned here but for the long term fix , please also see the subtask above.
fields.summary: New JIRA Issue View don't roll up the time tracking of subtasks to its parent from the board view

fields.description: We use slack as our internal communication tool. We've set it up in a way that each slack channel is correspondent to a Jira Epic Issue. Though we've integrated slack with Jira through the native connector, we can only edit the notifications based on the issue type, priority and security level(when on). We'd like to set it up in a way that we could use a JQL to specifically show what's related to that channel/epic issue. I believe the benefits are great when you are able to customize it
fields.summary: Allow users to set notifications on slack based on JQL filters
Getting HTTP 503 error when accessing Jira Cloud

fields.description: It would be great to allow users to create a sum field where the value is the result of a math operation of two other fields (+, -, /, *, ˆ, %, ...) or if user types the operation on the field itself, like = 1 + 1 and the result is 2 on the field.
fields.summary: Allow the ability to have math operations in fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Recently, JIRA/Confluence Cloud have *Site Access* feature which allow the user to self sign up when using the option below:-
* Anyone with one of the following email address domains can join:
* Anyone can join

However, from the Audit Logs , it doesn't provide the information whether the user account created is by self sign up or invited by the instance site admin.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the information in the Audit log. 
* User created by self sign up
* User created by invitation from site admin

h3. Why this is important
This provide more information to the administrator .
fields.summary: As admin, I would like to have a view in Audit Log whether user self sign up or invited

!sd.png|thumbnail!

fields.summary: Configurable number of users displayed for the "Request shared with" variable (${request.sharedwith}) in Service Desk notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Transition buttons are missing even when the they should be available according to the issue's current status and the user has permissions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an impacted issue and transition won't be available
#* Even if the user has permission and the transition have no condition/validator

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to see the available transitions.

h3. Actual Results
Transition buttons are missing and the issues gets stuck on current status.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
- Review the workflow:
-- Check if transitions are available for the issue status
-- Verify conditions and validators
- Review user permissions

If everything is correct, the try the following:
- Create a copy of the project's workflow
- Associate the copy of the workflow to the issue type of the impacted issue
- Publish the changes
- Associate the issue type back to the original workflow
- Publish the changes
fields.summary: Transition buttons are missing

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When the customer goes to [Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com] and applies some filters, such as Jira Software and Cloud and search for documentation, the results are returning Cloud and *Server* documentation.

h3. Environment
[Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to [Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com];
 # Apply filters, by choosing a product and environment (e.g. Jira Software, Cloud);
 # Type a search subject (e.g. Change log)


h3. Expected Results
It should return only documents of Jira Software Cloud.

h3. Actual Results
It is returning documentation of Jira Software Server and Cloud. Please see the screenshot below.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/search/?query=change+log&productName=Jira+Software&productVersion=Cloud
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-30 at 10.09.32.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Filtering Atlassian documentation search to Cloud only can return server specific KB articles

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When non-English language is set as first in "Order languages based on your preference" in the webbrowser and English is set as the language in the General configuration of Jira, the URL https://<instance>/home/notifications is shown in the non-English language.
All other screens are shown in English.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Move local (non-English) language to top of browser setting "Order languages based on your preference"
- Set all language options in Jira to English
- go to https://<instance>/home/notifications

h3. Expected Results
Text on screen https://<instance>/home/notifications is in English

h3. Actual Results
Text on screen https://<instance>/home/notifications is in local language
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Move English to top of "Order languages based on your preference" in browser settings
fields.summary: Home page of Jira instance in language that is first in the browser language order

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding project roles to a user from User Management, and if the user select an Agility project, it'll return 500 error with the following stacktrace:
{noformat} 
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Project configuration id does not match project roles configuration id
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.stateTrue(Assertions.java:205)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.DefaultProjectRoleManager.assertProjectConfigurationIdMatch(DefaultProjectRoleManager.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.DefaultProjectRoleManager.updateProjectRoleActors(DefaultProjectRoleManager.java:243)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.projectroles.DefaultProjectRoleService.updateActorsToProjectRole(DefaultProjectRoleService.java:905)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.projectroles.DefaultProjectRoleService.addActorsToProjectRole(DefaultProjectRoleService.java:1293)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.roles.EditUserProjectRoles.updateRoleActorsForProjectRole(EditUserProjectRoles.java:138)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.roles.EditUserProjectRoles.doExecute(EditUserProjectRoles.java:44)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:68)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
*Summary*
 The limitation in bulk import is set to create only 250 issues via single CSV file. This value cannot be adjusted in Jira Cloud. 
 Both validation and import throw incorrect error saying that this value can be changed in Advanced Settings.

*Environment*

Jira Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*

1.  Click *Issues* > *Search* *issues* > •••  > *Import issues from CSV*

2. *Bulk create: Setup* > *Choose File* > *Next*

3. *Settings* *-* Chose *Project* 
 *!Screen Shot 2018-05-31 at 1.49.07 PM.png|width=156,height=170!*
 *4.* *Map fields* > *Next*
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-31 at 1.50.58 PM.png|width=235,height=104!

3. Click *Validate*

4. Validation error is generated

!Screen Shot 2018-05-31 at 1.52.31 PM.png|width=378,height=179!
 5. Click *Begin Import*
 Same error generated as during the Validation process

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira mobile app 'Assigned to me' filter in Issues tab is giving out error in some instances.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud - iOS
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira mobile app
 # Click on Issues tab at the bottom of the screen
 # Select 'Assign to me' filter

h3. Expected Results

User should see all the issues that are assigned to them.
h3. Actual Results

Some users would get this screen:

!image-2018-05-28-16-41-58-003.png|width=189,height=336!
h3. Notes

The error message is triggered by 500 error when executing this request on the customer's instance:

_jql=assignee+%3D+currentUser()+ORDER+BY+Rank,+priority&startAt=0&maxResults=50&validateQuery=false&fields=summary,project,issuetype,status,priority,resolutiondate,duedate,updated,created,lastViewed&expand=schema_

Some instance that doesn't throw an error doesn't have 'Rank' in the query.
h3. Workaround

Create a new filter in Jira web, "jql=assignee in (currentUser()) order by created DESC" and named it 'Assigned to me 2'. This filter would be listed in Issues tab.
fields.summary: 'Assigned to me' filter in Issues tab in Jira mobile app gives out an error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There's currently no easy way to create an account tagged as *system* on JIRA. Only Marketplace add-ons can create a system account during their installation, when these accounts are created, they are used to perform actions on behalf of the app.

The alternative is to create a new licensed account on the instance (every account must have a valid email in order to authenticate and avoid issues in the future, E.g.: _The account gets locked and you need to reset its password by requesting a password reset email_) that will be dedicated to handle the communication between JIRA and other apps (custom scripts included). The account will need to have all the necessary permissions over the projects depending on the actions that it would perform, this is especially important if the account would also be used in custom scripts that can interact with the instance using REST API endpoints available in the Cloud platform (documentation for reference here: [Jira Cloud REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/]).

h3. Suggested Solution

JIRA Instances should provide a different, special type of accounts that don't belong to an individual user. Details about this concept can be found in the following documentation by Google: 

* [Cloud Identity and Access Management - Understanding Service Accounts|https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/understanding-service-accounts]
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator, I'd like to suggest the implementation of Service Accounts on JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 9 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, 

I am pleased to announce that the ability to edit the resolution field of an issue is now available on the new issue view.

The resolution field appears when an issue is closed and if the _*resolution*_ field has been configured to the issue type in the screen scheme (_issues_ > _screens_ > _configure_).  When this field is added, the *_resolution_* will appear as a select list when the issue is moved to a *_done_* status:

  !change-resolution.png|width=282,height=156!

For more information on adding fields to screens please refer to our documentation [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/manage-issue-screens/]. As part of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70476 we have also recently released the display of the resolved date and time.

 

Thanks

Jira Cloud Team
{panel}
In the old issue view, users were able to set the resolution in the issue view. In the new view, there are no option for this.

Note that you can see the Resolution if it is set, next to the Status action.

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/74644i175C27C06489809E/image-dimensions/2500?v=1.0&px=-1|width=547,height=368!

Though switching back to the old view solves this problem, it'll be great if we are able to set this in the new view, too.

*It is important to note that this is not a good practice to use the resolution field on Jira*

The behavior of not being able to set the resolution in the new issue view is more optimal to avoid the common configuration mistakes by users of setting the resolution field incorrectly in the old view. For a quick background in Jira, the resolution field plays a special role. When the resolution field is populated, the issue is considered to be closed in Jira. On the other hand, when then the resolution field is empty, the issue is considered to be open in Jira.

The *common configuration* mistake for users is to allow the resolution field to be edited on "Open" status and this can lead to end users populating the field incorrectly and unintentionally closing the issues. When that happens, certain features in Jira may be skewed.

That being said, we recommend checking the documentation about the best practices on using the "Resolution" field and how to properly configure your instance:
 * [Best practices on using the resolution field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/best-practices-on-using-the-resolution-field-968660796.html]

We strongly advise following this documentation to set up the Jira Cloud instance, because eventually the new issue view will be definitely rolled out, and this will ensure that your instance is properly configured and won't have problems in the future.
fields.summary: Ability to set the resolution in the new issue full-view

fields.description:
A common scenario is "Show me all the things we need to work on, order by priorities and due dates"

Unfortunately the current limitation of JQL is that when you order by a field in descending order, Blanks / Nulls appear first. While this makes sense in some scenarios ("Hey, this doesn't have a due date set - set one!") it doesn't when not all tasks have a due date.

Suggestion: Enhance the JQL Spec to add "blanks last" and "blanks first". I used "blanks" instead of "nulls" as currently "where <field> is null" is actually "where <field> is blank" in the JQL language.
fields.summary: JQL Order by <Field> Desc Blanks Last

fields.description:
Users who rely on screen reading software to access JIRA find a number of issues. It would be great if the Atlassian team were to work on improving these so that JIRA is usable by all. Here are some details for you:

1. When creating an issue in JIRA, a screen reader user is able to use both the issue drop-down and the [Select issue] link to select an issue. Unfortunately, the user is then unable to access the list of added linked issues to make sure they were linked correctly.
This problem seems to occur for any drop-down that allows you to select multiple items. E.g seems to be the same issue for selecting labels

2. Some other issues with the create screen:
There are problems with linking field labels to their input controls e.g. Project has a label tag with a for=project
But the input field's id is actually project-field
Seems to be an issue with labels for auto-complete dropdowns

Other fields with the same issue are:
Issue type label for=issuetype input fields id=issuetype-field
Priority label for=priority input id=priority-field
Labels label for=labels input id=labels-textarea
Issue label for=issuelinks-issues input id=issuelinks-issues-textarea
Assignee label for=assignee input id=assignee-field
And for custom fields such as epic link and sprint
fields.summary: Improve Accessibility

fields.description:
I would like to point out some points on [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-764478441.html] documentation that could be improved.



*Regarding the "valid" and "invalid" examples:*

 Those examples need to more clear, stating that the first row must be a header, and subsequent rows will bedata (instead of just two very similar examples, that do not explain clearly why one is correct while the other is not), Additionally, those examples could include the first row (header) and a data row following it.

"The data fields appear to be pretty limited - much moreso than
I'd expect. Some data appears to be a part of my company's specific
structure (i'm relatively new to the company and am still learning), so
things like "HLE" (High-level estimate of work) aren't a default JIRA field."

----
*Regarding Fields:*

It would be really great if we could include additional info regarding the fields being exported, as it can clarify each field specific info, such as proposed by a customer below:

"It would be helpful to have a list of fields and their purposes, in order to better prep a CSV import file."

"At a minimum, I would probably reference the base fields and what their
possible values might be."

"For Example:
* Summary: the title of your item to be imported
* Description: The description of your item to be imported
* Issue Type: The index value of the Issue Type (within your project) that this item should be categorized as. This is dependent on your project configuration.
* Assignee: The person who the item will be assigned to. Use their JIRA ID; if you do not, a new user will be created for the ID specified.
* Reporter: The person who is reporting the item in the first place. Again, use their JIRA ID, or a new user will be created for the ID specified."
fields.summary: Update 'Creating issues using the CSV importer' documentation

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 1 Dec 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Thanks for the feedback on configuring the jira.issue.actions.order setting in the new issue view. As you may be aware, we will shortly be releasing the ability for end users to sort actions from the issue view. You can follow this work here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73076

As a result of this, we will not be working on the jira.issue.actions.order setting in the short term, as we review usage of this feature. We will keep this ticket open for now so we can provide updates.
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 10 Dec 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. this feature, *Ability to sort comments/activities on an issue*, is being under consideration to be prioritised in the next couple of months. we will keep you posted with the updates. I know this has taken a while to build out, but rebuilding Jira issues is no small feat, so we very much appreciate your patience on this.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
*Original ticket title:* Configuring the 'jira.issue.actions.order' property on Jira's Advanced Settings page has no effect in the new Issue detail view
h3. Summary

If the comments sorting is changed to 'descending' by the 'jira.issue.actions.order' property on Jira's Advanced Settings, the new issue detail view does not respect the new settings and keep showing the comments on 'ascending' order
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a Jira software project and add some comments to it
 # From Jira home page, click *Settings > System > General configuration*
 # At the top-right of the screen, click *Advanced settings*
 # Next to the *jira.issue.actions.order* key, change the value to *desc*
 # Look at the issues comments on issue view and board's issue detail view

h3. Expected Results

Both views show the comments on descending creation order
h3. Actual Results

Both  issue view shows the comments on ascending order

[^Screen Shot 2018-05-23 at 7.26.29 PM.png]

!Screen Shot 2018-05-23 at 7.29.59 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * It happens only on the new issue detail view (Labs feature)

h3. Workaround

No current work around.
fields.summary: Configuring the default order of actions to desc. in advanced settings does not reflect in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "Log Work" functionality is using the JIRA System "Default user time zone" to set the "Date Started".
It should be using the "User Time zone" set in the Profile section

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue, click on "Log Work" and check the Time in "Date Started"
# Change your user timezone by going to your Profile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is created with the *sysadmin* username and the username of this user is changed to anything else, an entry is added to the *app_user* table with the user_key as *sysadmin*.
After that, when you try to generate a backup it fails as during the backup process a dummy user *sysadmin* and an entry into the app_user table is also added to this *sysadmin* user, as there's already an entry for the other user that changed its name, the export fails.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with the username as *sysadmin*. (Since you cannot specify a username on the user's creation, you can set the user's email as sysadmin@.... as the username is always the content before the '@' on the email, hence, the user would be created as *sysadmin*)
# Change the username of this newly created user to anything else.
# Try to generate a backup

h3. Expected Results
The backup is generated successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The export process fails with the following error:
{code}
Export error

Export failed (Starting export)

Please try again later or contact support if error persists.
{code}

On the logs, we can find the following error:
{code}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.app_user (ID, user_key, lower_user_name) VALUES (?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "uk_user_key" Detail: Key (user_key)=(sysadmin) already exists.)
{code}

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Backup is failing if a user is created with sysadmin as username and has the username changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Import into Cloud fails if there is a user where the email has a domain _@example.com_ e.g. *testuser@example.com*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user and set its email as something like 'newuser@example.com'. Just make sure that the domain is @example.com
# Generate a backup of this instance
# Import into Cloud.

h3. Expected Results
The import should complete properly and the user is imported.

h3. Actual Results
The import fails with and the following error:
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper$WrappingCrowdException
{code}

In the logs we can see the following errors:
{code}
Caused by: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.BadRequestException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"400","scimType":"invalidSyntax","detail":"The supplied schema was malformed. We detected a problem with the field emailAddress; value was test@example.com","errorType":"InvalidSchema","message":"The supplied schema was malformed. We detected a problem with the field emailAddress; value was test@example.com","data":"emailAddress;test@example.com"}
{code}
 
h3.Workaround
# Delete the user from the source instance
# Change the user's domain in the _entities.xml_ file to anything different from _@example.com_.
fields.summary: Import into Cloud failing if there is a user with a domain of @example.com

fields.description:
h2. Suggestion

There should be a feature to aggregate all comments where you've been mentioned in and filter out the N/A comments.
Using a query such as [summary ~ currentUser() OR description ~ currentUser() OR comment ~ currentUser()] will give you all the tickets you've been mentioned but all other comments will be included as well.
{panel:title=Original request}
It would be great if there was a feature to see all the comments directed at me in an aggregated way. Whenever a ticket is updated, whether the comment is old or new, always tends to come up first as the ticket is updated. I usually try to find my comments by using queries but due to this update issue, the list I get contains both old and new comments based on when the ticket was last updated. This is not a full prove solution and would request to add a solution to this in future.

I meant comments or anywhere where I have been tagged like, @user. It would be great if there is a feature to see all these issues in an aggregated form.
{panel}
fields.summary: Aggregate comments you've been mentioned in
